data.title: أرشيف المتحف الفلسطيني الرقمي : Still Image : The Continuation of Yedioth Ahronoth's Paper Clipping Titled "Yedioth Ahronoth Asks and Arab Notables Respond", 1967 [0352.03.0032]
data.text:
0352.03.0032

The Continuation of Yedioth Ahronoth's Paper Clipping Titled "Yedioth Ahronoth Asks and Arab Notables Respond", 1967

Printed in Hebrew, this archival item documents a paper clipping from the "Yedioth Ahronoth Newspaper" featuring the continuation of an article titled "Yedioth Ahronoth Asks and Arab Notables Respond", published on 13 October 1967 with reference to a group of Arab notables including Antone Attallah and Anwar Nusseibeh who delivered a statement on the reasons standing between the involvement of Palestinian refugees among Arab countries such as the rupture of the economic situation within Egypt and Syria leading to the difficulty of accommodating these refugees despite the mutuality of culture in addition to their feeling of being in a place for a short time unlike being in their homes which they were forcibly displaced from, hence, Nusseibeh’s conformation of his strong personal ties with Jerusalem which he was born and raised in while staying in Jordan during his occupation to several ministerial roles among the Jordanian government. On his behalf, Antone Attallah spoke of his sympathy with the victims of the holocaust as well as his belief in the necessity of the chastisement of the Nazis who conducted it causing the death of around 3 million Jew, saying that his feelings of empathy do not deny the right of the Jews in Germany to own houses and properties, thus, they have no right to settle in the lands of the refugees, and concluded by stressing on the Palestinian people's right of return to their homeland as long as it has the capacity of receiving new Jewish immigrants.

Date created

TYPE

COLLECTION

Source of Description

Nusseibeh, Sary. 9 June 2021. "The Anwar Nusseibeh Collection". Interview with PMDA Researcher Razan Ibreigeth. The Palestinian Museum Digital Archive.
